name: homozygote

a homozygous person, animal, or organism (= having two of the same form of cell material that controls a particular characteristic and so able to pass on only that form to his, her, or its young): This embryonic mutation would alter the ratio of homozygotes to heterozygotes. The recessive homozygote generally has white eggs and pink eyes. See
homozygous
More examplesFewer examplesThe intervention can turn a heterozygote into a homozygote. Studies provided evidence that both types of carriers - homozygotes and heterozygotes - can show potential markers of neurodegeneration.Both my parents are homozygotes for the European variant of the gene.
